intro: Endiandra jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and aromatic wood. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forest environments, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in terminal panicles, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and durable timber, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
